summary: WHILE RIDING ON THE WAY HOME FROM WORK, I WENT TO SHIFT FROM ONE GEAR TO THE NEXT AND ALL OF A SUDDEN IT MADE A WEIRD SOUND LIKE A BALL BEARING BOUNCING AROUND INSIDE THE MOTOR, THAT'S THE BEST WAY THAT I COULD DESCRIBE THIS. I THEN QUICKLY REACTED AND PRESSED THE CLUTCH LEVER IN AND COASTED AND PULLED OVER TO THE SHOULDER. SINCE THAT INCIDENT THE BIKE DOESN'T SHIFT THE SAME AND THE CLUTCH WOULD ENGAGE WITH THE LEVER ALMOST ALL THE WAY OUT WHICH PRIOR TO THAT THE CLUTCH ENGAGE SOONER THEN THAT. I NO LONGER FEEL SAFE RIDING THE BIKE. I WILL BE CONTACTING KAWASAKI MANUFACTURER AND THE SHOP WHERE I PURCHASED THE BIKE. (KAWASAKI ZX1100 2002)  *JB  *SCC    ***DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS****764522
